newsitem.title: USA: Texas/w Okla fed cattle brisk at $63 - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Texas/w Okla fed cattle brisk at $63 - USDA.

text.p: Trade was moderate to active in the panhandle area Tuesday afternoon after a very slow start Tuesday morning, USDA said.
Slaughter steers were $0.25 per cwt lower and heifers $1.00 lower than last test. Feedlots reporting moderate to good inquiry from buyers.
Sales reported on 12,600 head slaughter steers and 10,700 heifers; 53,100 head confirmed for the week to date, including 24,300 formulated cattle to be shipped this week.
Note - all cattle prices based on net weights FOB the feedlot after a 4 percent shrink.
Slaughter Steers - Select and Choice 2-3 1100-1250 lbs 63.00, hot carcass basis 101.50.
Slaughter Heifers - Select and Choice 2-3 1000-1150 lbs 63.00, hot carcass basis 101.50.
Wk to Date - 53,100 Week Ago - 24,700 Year Ago - 81,900
